kawigi.language
Class CPPLang

java.lang.Object
  kawigi.language.EditorLanguage
      kawigi.language.CPPLang

public final class CPPLang
extends EditorLanguage

Class introducing language-dependent features for C++. Class is made as singleton.

See Also:
EditorLanguage

public static CPPLang getInstance()
Returns single instance of the class.

Returns:
Instance of CPPLang

getTypeName

public java.lang.String getTypeName(EditorDataType type)
Gets type name in C++ given representation of necessary type in EditorDataType enumeration. For C++ method especially takes care of long long type which name can differ from standard in local compiler.

Overrides:
getTypeName in class EditorLanguage
Parameters:
type - Type to convert to name
Returns:
Type name in C++
See Also:
EditorLanguage.getType(CharSequence)

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the name of this language in lowercase ('cpp'). This name is used in name of category in properties for this language.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
Name of this language - 'cpp'

Returns:

preamble

protected void preamble()
Specific function for inserting some stuff before code generation starts. Adds headers and "using namespace" statement to be able to compile even if user template doesn't include this stuff.

Overrides:
preamble in class EditorLanguage

markTestBegin

protected void markTestBegin(int num)
Adds mark of the beginning of test. This mark will be used at code loading to find the place where test data begins. For C++ we need also put each test call to different block to be able declare array variables with the same name.

Overrides:
markTestBegin in class EditorLanguage
Parameters:
num - Number of the test
See Also:
EditorLanguage.markTestBegin(int)

markTestEnd

protected void markTestEnd()
Adds mark of ending of the code related to one test case. This mark is made basically on beauty of generated code purposes. For C++ we additionally close block opened in markTestBegin.

Overrides:
markTestEnd in class EditorLanguage
See Also:
markTestBegin(int), EditorLanguage.markTestEnd()

escapeSequences

protected void escapeSequences(java.lang.StringBuilder val,
                               EditorDataType type)
Escapes all special characters in string constants or string-array constants. For C++ it additionally gets rid of double question marks as they form trigraphs.

Overrides:
escapeSequences in class EditorLanguage
Parameters:
val - In input it's constant to be escaped, in output it's escaped constant ready for inserting in code.
type - Data type represented by given constant.
See Also:
unescapeSequences(StringBuilder, EditorDataType), EditorLanguage.escapeSequences(StringBuilder, EditorDataType)

                                 EditorDataType type)
Removes all escapings in string and string-array constants made by escapeSequences.

getTestParamRegex

protected java.lang.String getTestParamRegex(int num,
                                             EditorDataType type)
Gets regular expression for finding test case parameter initialization. For C++ it takes care of empty vector initialization.

Overrides:
getTestParamRegex in class EditorLanguage
Parameters:
num - Number of parameter
type - Type of parameter
Returns:
Regular expression for finding this parameter in code
